text: gold orange pour. ARoma perfumy watermelon with rind. tastes sour, tangy tropical watermelon. tart mouthfeel.

Had this at Where The Wild Beers Are VII (2016). Pours a hazed amber with a thin white head. Big watermelon on the nose. Tangy, salty, watermelon all over. Long watermelon finish, salty, tangy, lively.
Bottle at GABF. Pours a hazy orange with no head. The aroma is strong watermelon seed, funk, oak, salt. Thin body, tart watermelon, light salt, really enjoyed this.
Salty watermelon taste and smell. Enjoyable, but I would have like more watermelon and less salt. Medium body, medium carbonation, and mild foam.
Glowing burnt orange with no head. Aroma is sour summer fruit, watermelon, and funk. Taste is sour summer stone fruit, funk, oak, sugar and watermelon. Juicy up front with a very dry finish.

Bottle poured a clear deep golden-orange hue w/ no head. Moderate aromas of white wine and watermelon. Initial favor is faint sweet w/ bold sour finish. Tastes are Riesling, watermelon rind, and minerals. Faint carbonation.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Bottle. Clear medium gold color, with a fizzy off white head. Fruity, maybe some watermelon, not getting much salt, a bit tart, and some yeast. Ok.

Bottle shared by Marcus. Pours dark translucent gold with not much head. Aroma is light watermelon - not much else. Med body, almost. Flavor is like Hungarion green grape mixed with watermelon. Its a bit tart, not very salty. Pleasent enough. Fairly dry finish.

Bottle from Whole Foods, Sacramento. Pours dark golden with no head and a light green grape aroma. There is a delicate moderately sour white wine flavor with some green grape too. Easy to drink and tasty. Sort of a gose I guess.

This is one good beer. Man did I not think this was going to be good. Sounds terrible, but somehow the salty watermelon taste plays really nicely together. Beer is a nice slightly pink body. Aroma is ok, but what I really like is the taste.
Just like a watermelon warhead. Tart almost artificially though. Not much head. Definite watermelon. Super tart. Candy like. Interesting not bad. Some salt.
16.9 oz bottle. Hazy light Amber with no head. Aroma is of lemon, sour, watermelon, and light hay. Taste is of watermelon, warheads candy, grain, straw, sour, and fairly dry.

Bottle at home. Pours hazy orange with a small, bubbly white head, short retention with no lacing. Aroma is watermelon, earthy wheat malt, salt, and lactic acid. Flavor is lightly phenolic smoke, earthy wheat malt, watermelon, lactic acid and a dry finish. Light body and light carbonation.

500ml bottle. Hazy golden color with minimal head. A big H2Omelon aroma wafts off this mofo. Slight briny note as well. Big intense sour, salty flavor. Nice balance, good fresh melon notes, really acidic and biting. Medium body with low carbonation. Really enjoyable. "Gose" down well!

Love it Candy of a sour very enjoyable. Salty watermelon, salt is more 
present, watermelon in the background
No cheap thrills, a decent sour, refreshing,

Poured from bottle into a Brother Thelonious chalace. Pours gold with no head or lace. Aroma of tart citrus and watermelon. Low carbonation and big mouthfeel. Flavors of tart lime, kiwi, watermelon, slight salt, grains. Overall tart, flavorful, mouth puckering and unique.

Bottle about 6 months old. Lightly cloudy ruddy orange. Low carbonation. I swore Paradox would never get another dime of my money after how they handled their infectatorium, err brewery, after I got infected and they decided they would make sours exclusively but so many people raved about the earlier version of this (#15?), I finally pulled the trigger. Nose is watermelon rind and flesh, some lacto funk. Taste is salted watermelon, finishing dry with lingering salt and lacto funk. This is actually really delicious and I wish I had bought more in the summer. But I cant in clear conscious open my wallet to this brewery on a regular basis after how they denied numerous raging infection problems in their beers for so long.
Absolutely awesome. Tons of watermelon on the nose and taste. Very tart but not super sour. No Paradox Ive had has been though.

Bottle care of Josh and Maryanna shared, pours murky and flat orange. Smell is vegetal watermelon and cucumber earth. Flavor is sour and salty orange, cheese, light watermelon, and acidic funk. Booze insanely well hidden. This shit be burnin meh.
Bottle. Pours a vibrant orangish amber with minimal head. Aroma and taste slightly sour but with a heavy watermelon and salty taste. Interesting but could be better balanced.
Bottle. Pours a light gold with faint head. Aroma is watermellon juice and ocean. Taste is a great tart watermellon that lingers. Light sour notes. Nice
user_location: Morro Bay via Orange County, California, USA

text:
Good watermelon nose and taste in a well brewed wine ba sour.
Heard their base beer is brewed by Funkwerks?
Would love to try again a year or two later and see how it matures.

Bottle, thanks Brian! Pours quite hazy Arnold Palmer, minimal head or lacing. Aroma is straight up watermelon, sea air, a bit of Jolly rancher character about it, but not in a bad way. Flavor is light plus tart, fruity, fairly salty, lemon and watermelon, with the faintest cucumber note. Medium body. Surprised to read that this was 9% after the fact. Solid beer.
Hazy orange. Tart watermelon aroma comes through nicely. Similar flavor, bit of funk. Very nice change of pace with the watermelon.
One of the best watermelon beers Ive had. They nailed it with this one. Tart, funky, and really captured the fresh watermelon flavor. Such a unique beer, definitely worth experiencing.
One of the best paradox beers yet! Tart and funky but huge juicy watermelon character. The salinity is barely noticeable but adds lots of depth. Truly a fantastic and innovative wild sour.
Bottle..Pour is hazy gold with a white head..Nose is watermellon juice, musty, spice, funk, oak..Taste is spice, jolly rancher, sweettarts, tart, some salt..the tits
Bottle at WTWBA 2015 in Minneapolis. Hazy gold, murky, tart/sour watermelon notes in this one. Hint of salt. Pretty good.

From notes. Enjoyed on September 19 at Travis house. Poured from a 500 mL bottle. The pour is a straw yellow color with a nice cap of white head that falls to a collar, leaving nothing behind. The aroma is pretty good. You get a nice watermelon character with a nice tartness to it. There is a little wet oak and maybe a touch of graininess on the back end. The flavor is good. It reminds me of a watermelon flavored WarHead. I loved it. Need to find some of those babies to buy. The mouth feel is thin, crisp, but sharply carbonated and beautifully done. The aftertaste is lingeringly sour watermelon with just a kick of salt. Really, really good.

Sampled from the bottle at ABR 2015. Pours a hazy pale yellow with a gold hue and a white head that dissipates to the edges. Aroma has a slightly tart watermelon with some light oak and a light grain supporting. Flavor has a nice dry sour watermelon note with a bit of oak and dry whine.

Pours a cloudy orange with no head what so ever. Has the aroma of sour watermelon. Taste follows the nose with a big hit of tartness. Aftertaste follows the nose also which is good. Overall this is a really unique ale for me and not sure its a style Ill try a lot but Im glad I tried this one.
UPDATED: SEP 5, 2015 Bottle. Pours orange gold white head. Nose/taste of sea salt, watermelon juice, oak, white wine and coriander - medium body. Tastes like a watermelon gose.

500ml bottle, #497/2040. Aroma is sweet watermelon with subtle citrus and vinous sour notes. Pours pale golden colored with a non existent head. Starts with citrus and white wine flavors to go with the lively, sparkling wine like mouthfeel. Finishes smooth with sweet watermelon coating the palate with a touch of saltiness. Excellent sour!
Pours a hazy gold with no head. Aroma of watermelon, sour wheat and lemon peel. Taste is tart wheat, watermelon, lemon and salt. Very tasty
Pour is cloudy, blond with hints of pink. Aroma is sour with sweetness. Taste is a sweet initial flavor, a little sour a little champagne, fruit, fish is sour, melons and slightly sweet, great beer.

500 ml bottle, #1093/2040, purchased at Biggie Wine & Liquor and poured into a goblet. Cloudy, light golden-orange appearance with a fully diminishing white head. Aroma of watermelons, tart fruitiness, sour notes, funky yeast, light coriander, wheat malts, light oak, white wine and salt. Similar flavor, tart, juicy, lightly sour and fruity with a mild salty character and light sweetness. Medium body with a smooth feel and a tart, semi-dry finish. Overall, its refreshing and pretty easy to drink, the alcohol is completely hidden. An imperial watermelon gose, if you will.
